As four of our fellow Shelby County municipal school systems prepare to open on Monday (Millington Municipal Schools opened this Monday with us), we want to thank them all for their collaboration and support as we prepared for our individual openings.

In particular, we want to thank Arlington Community Schools, Bartlett City Schools, and Millington Municipal Schools for allowing us to borrow student desks that we needed to meet our social distancing guidelines for this school year. While each system is different, the leaders of all six systems (including Germantown Municipal School District and Collierville Schools) support each other in our shared goals of helping students in every way we can. We're fortunate to have such caring and dedicated partners, and we wish them and their students and employees all the best this year!

For the second year in a row, Lakeland School System has been honored with the Best Communities for Music Education designation from The NAMM Foundation for its outstanding commitment to music education!

Now in its 21st year, the Best Communities for Music Education designation is awarded to districts that demonstrate outstanding achievement in efforts to provide music access and education to all students. To qualify for the Best Communities designation, Lakeland School System answered detailed questions about funding, graduation requirements, music class participation, instruction time, facilities, support for the music programs, Responses were verified with school officials and reviewed by The Music Research Institute at the University of Kansas.

Congrats to our awesome music educators at Lakeland Elementary School and Lakeland Middle Preparatory School for continuing their commitment to outstanding music education!

We are pleased to announce that Lakeland School System has been honored with the Best Communities for Music Education designation from The NAMM Foundation for its outstanding commitment to music education.

Now in its 20th year, the Best Communities for Music Education designation is awarded to districts that demonstrate outstanding achievement in efforts to provide music access and education to all students. To qualify for the Best Communities designation, the staff at LSS answered detailed questions about funding, academic requirements, music class participation, instruction time, facilities, and community support for our music programs. Responses were verified and reviewed by The Music Research Institute at the University of Kansas.

LSS superintendent Dr. Ted Horrell said, "Music education has been an important point of emphasis at both Lakeland Elementary School and Lakeland Middle Preparatory School, and we couldn't be more proud of our incredible students and staff for earning this national recognition."

Congratulations to the 19 Spanish students from Lakeland Middle Preparatory School who attained national recognition for excellent performance on the 2018 National Spanish Examinations. Kudos also to LMPS Spanish teacher, Kandice Lee!

Students from LMPS earned a total of 19 recognitions. One gold, one silver five bronze medals along with 12 honorable mentions. “Attaining a medal or honorable mention for any student on the National Spanish Examinations is very prestigious,” said Kevin Cessna-Buscemi, National Director of the Exams, “because the exams are the largest of their kind in the United States with over 150,000 students participating in 2018.”

The National Spanish Examinations are administered each year in grades 6 through 12, and are sponsored by the American Association of Teachers of Spanish and Portuguese.

The National Spanish Examinations are administered each year in grades 6 through 12, and are sponsored by the American Association of Teachers of Spanish and Portuguese.

Update on TN Ready Testing: Lakeland Middle experienced disruptions to the testing platform today around 10:00 AM that seem to have been experienced statewide by other systems that were testing at that time. The main issue involved the submitting of the tests that required students to to sign out, restart their computers, login to the platform again, and attempt to submit again. In many cases this had to happen multiple times in order to submit a test, and this often happened as other students in the room were still testing. The scale of the issue required administrative and technical staff to go classroom by classroom to work with students on submission issues and pass on direction from the state. Unfortunately, we are not certain if the complete data from each test was submitted.

We want to thank our teachers, students, and administrators who have diligently and persistently attempted to power through these issues under such difficult circumstances.

post_text: Our teachers at both schools showed resilience, flexibility, and dedication this morning working through the initial hour or so without full power due to some electrical lines being down. Our backup generators worked well in the interim, and the administrations and staff made the best of the situation until the power was restored. We are so grateful to our educators who take their professional learning so seriously!

Our 2018-19 general education teacher positions are now posted to the Careers page of the Lakeland School System website. Also, we have just posted a teacher assistant
position at Lakeland Middle Preparatory School as well as a substitute nurse position for the system.

We know we will have at least two teaching positions at the middle school, but all who are interested in either school are encouraged to apply now to be considered as positions become available.

Please note that certified (generally teaching) positions are applied for via SearchSoft, while classified positions (like the teacher assistant and sub nurse) are applied for via Skyward.
